org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2
Interface Deserializer

All Known Subinterfaces:
SerDe
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDeserializer, AbstractSerDe, AvroSerDe, BinarySortableSerDe, ByteStreamTypedSerDe, ColumnarSerDe, ColumnarSerDeBase, DelimitedJSONSerDe, DynamicSerDe, LazyBinaryColumnarSerDe, LazyBinarySerDe, LazySimpleSerDe, MetadataTypedColumnsetSerDe, NullStructSerDe, OrcSerde, RegexSerDe, TestSerDe, ThriftByteStreamTypedSerDe, ThriftDeserializer, TypedSerDe
Deprecated. 

@Deprecated
public interface Deserializer

HiveDeserializer is used to deserialize the data from hadoop Writable to a custom java object that can be of any type that the developer wants. HiveDeserializer also provides the ObjectInspector which can be used to inspect the internal structure of the object (that is returned by deserialize function). All deserializers should extend the abstract class AbstractDeserializer, and eventually Deserializer interface should be removed

deserialize

Object deserialize(Writable blob)
                   throws SerDeException
Deprecated. 
Deserialize an object out of a Writable blob. In most cases, the return value of this function will be constant since the function will reuse the returned object. If the client wants to keep a copy of the object, the client needs to clone the returnDeserializered value by calling ObjectInspectorUtils.getStandardObject().

Parameters:
blob - The Writable object containing a serialized object
Returns:
A Java object representing the contents in the blob.
Throws:
SerDeException

getObjectInspector

                                   throws SerDeException
Deprecated. 
Get the object inspector that can be used to navigate through the internal structure of the Object returned from deserialize(...).

Throws:
SerDeException

Returns statistics collected when serializing
